newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: CRICKET-AKRAM LEADS PAKISTAN REVIVAL V ZIMBABWE.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-AKRAM LEADS PAKISTAN REVIVAL V ZIMBABWE.

text.p: Pakistan captain Wasim Akram scored an unbeaten half-century to lead his side's revival on the third day of the first cricket test against Zimbabwe on Saturday.
Left-handed Akram had made a polished 75 not out, his fifth half-century in 71 tests, as Pakistan went into lunch at 293 for seven in response to Zimbabwe's first innings total of 375.
Pakistan, 189 for six overnight, lost only Moin Khan in a productive morning session during which 104 runs were added.
Moin had taken his score from three to 18 before becoming leg-spinner Paul Strang's fifth victim.
He failed to get over an attempted square-cut and was taken by Andrew Whittal at point after adding 54 runs for the seventh wicket with Akram.
Akram drove crisply and brought up his half-century from 70 balls with his seventh four, a sweetly timed drive off Whittal.
His innings also included three sixes, all struck cleanly off Strang who has taken five for 110.
At lunch, Saqlain Mushtaq was on seven in an unbroken eighth-wicket stand of 56, Pakistan's best against the visitors.
